import { Analytics } from "@/components/analytics";
import { Footer } from "@/components/layout/footer";
import { Header } from "@/components/layout/header";
import { fontMono, fontSans } from "@/lib/fonts";
import { ThemeProvider } from "next-themes";
import "./globals.css";

export { metadata } from "@/lib/metadata";

export default function RootLayout({
	children,
}: Readonly<{
	children: React.ReactNode;
}>) {
	return (
		<html lang="en" suppressHydrationWarning>
			<body className={`${fontSans.variable} ${fontMono.variable} antialiased`}>
				<ThemeProvider attribute="class" defaultTheme="system" enableSystem>
					<div className="flex min-h-screen flex-col">
						<Header />
						<main className="flex-1">{children}</main>
						<Footer />
					</div>
					<Analytics />
				</ThemeProvider>
			</body>
		</html>
	);
}
</result>

<result>
# Portfolio

A modern, performant portfolio website built with Next.js 15, React 19, and Tailwind CSS v4.

## Tech Stack

- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router and Turbopack
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS v4
- **Content**: MDX with Velite
- **Testing**: Jest + React Testing Library
- **Linting**: ESLint + Biome
- **Deployment**: Vercel

## Getting Started

```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Run development server
npm run dev

# Build for production
npm run build

# Run tests
npm test
```

## Project Structure

```
├── app/                 # Next.js App Router pages
│   ├── (home)/         # Home page route group
│   ├── [slug]/         # Dynamic blog post routes
│   └── blog/           # Blog listing page
├── components/         # React components
│   ├── blog/          # Blog-specific components
│   ├── home/          # Home page sections
│   ├── layout/        # Header, Footer, etc.
│   ├── mdx/           # MDX rendering components
│   └── ui/            # Reusable UI components
├── content/           # MDX content files
│   └── posts/         # Blog posts
├── docs/              # Project documentation
│   └── adr/           # Architecture Decision Records
├── lib/               # Utility functions and configs
└── public/            # Static assets
```

## Documentation

- [Setup Guide](docs/setup.md)
- [Component Library](docs/component-library.md)
- [Architecture Decision Records](docs/adr/)

## License

MIT
</result>

<result>
# Capstone Project: Portfolio Website

## Overview

Build a professional portfolio website showcasing your skills, projects, and experience as a software developer. The site should demonstrate modern web development practices and serve as both a personal brand platform and a technical showcase.

## Core Requirements

### 1. Home Page
- **Hero Section**: Name, title, brief tagline, and call-to-action buttons
- **Skills Section**: Display technical skills with visual indicators
- **Projects Section**: Highlight 3-4 featured projects with images and descriptions
- **Experience Section**: Timeline or cards showing work history
- **Contact Section**: Contact form or links to professional profiles

### 2. Blog System
- **Blog Listing Page**: Grid/list of blog posts with pagination
- **Individual Post Pages**: Full MDX support with code highlighting
- **Categories/Tags**: Organize posts by topic
- **Reading Time**: Estimate and display reading time

### 3. Technical Requirements
- **Performance**: Lighthouse score >90 on all metrics
- **Accessibility**: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
- **SEO**: Proper meta tags, Open Graph, sitemap, robots.txt
- **Responsive**: Mobile-first design, works on all screen sizes
- **Dark Mode**: System preference detection with manual toggle

### 4. Content Management
- **MDX Support**: Write blog posts in MDX with custom components
- **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript coverage
- **Content Validation**: Schema validation for frontmatter

## Nice-to-Have Features

### Phase 2 Enhancements
- [ ] Search functionality for blog posts
- [ ] RSS feed
- [ ] Newsletter signup
- [ ] Analytics dashboard
- [ ] Project detail pages
- [ ] Testimonials section

### Phase 3 Enhancements
- [ ] Interactive resume/CV page
- [ ] Code playground for demos
- [ ] Guest book or comments
- [ ] i18n support
- [ ] PWA capabilities

## Design Guidelines

### Typography
- Use system fonts or optimized web fonts
- Clear hierarchy with consistent sizing
- Comfortable line height for reading (1.5-1.7)

### Colors
- Professional color palette
- Sufficient contrast ratios (4.5:1 minimum)
- Consistent use of accent colors

### Spacing
- Consistent spacing scale (4px base)
- Generous whitespace for readability
- Responsive spacing adjustments

## Success Metrics

1. **Performance**: All Lighthouse scores >90
2. **Accessibility**: Zero critical accessibility issues
3. **SEO**: Proper indexing and meta information
4. **User Experience**: Smooth navigation, fast interactions
5. **Code Quality**: Clean, maintainable, well-documented code
</result>

import Link from "next/link";
import { ThemeToggle } from "./theme-toggle";

const navItems = [
	{ href: "/", label: "Home" },
	{ href: "/blog", label: "Blog" },
];

export function Header() {
	return (
		<header className="sticky top-0 z-50 w-full border-b border-border/40 bg-background/95 backdrop-blur-sm supports-backdrop-filter:bg-background/60">
			<div className="container flex h-14 max-w-screen-2xl items-center">
				<nav className="flex items-center space-x-6 text-sm font-medium">
					{navItems.map((item) => (
						<Link
							key={item.href}
							href={item.href}
							className="text-foreground/60 transition-colors hover:text-foreground/80"
						>
							{item.label}
						</Link>
					))}
				</nav>
				<div className="flex flex-1 items-center justify-end space-x-2">
					<ThemeToggle />
				</div>
			</div>
		</header>
	);
}
</result>

import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge";

const skills = {
	frontend: ["React", "Next.js", "TypeScript", "Tailwind CSS", "Vue.js"],
	backend: ["Node.js", "Python", "PostgreSQL", "Redis", "GraphQL"],
	tools: ["Git", "Docker", "AWS", "Vercel", "CI/CD"],
};

export function SkillsSection() {
	return (
		<section id="skills" className="container py-16 md:py-24">
			<h2 className="mb-8 text-3xl font-bold tracking-tight">Skills</h2>
			<div className="grid gap-8 md:grid-cols-3">
				{Object.entries(skills).map(([category, items]) => (
					<div key={category}>
						<h3 className="mb-4 text-lg font-semibold capitalize">
							{category}
						</h3>
						<div className="flex flex-wrap gap-2">
							{items.map((skill) => (
								<Badge key={skill} variant="secondary">
									{skill}
								</Badge>
							))}
						</div>
					</div>
				))}
			</div>
		</section>
	);
}
</result>

<parameter name="file_path">/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/lib/posts.ts</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
import { posts } from "#site/content";

export function getAllPosts() {
	return posts
		.filter((post) => post.published)
		.sort((a, b) => new Date(b.date).getTime() - new Date(a.date).getTime());
}

export function getPostBySlug(slug: string) {
	return posts.find((post) => post.slug === slug && post.published);
}
</result>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/velite.config.ts</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
import rehypeAutolinkHeadings from "rehype-autolink-headings";
import rehypePrettyCode from "rehype-pretty-code";
import rehypeSlug from "rehype-slug";
import remarkGfm from "remark-gfm";
import { defineCollection, defineConfig, s } from "velite";

const posts = defineCollection({
	name: "Post",
	pattern: "posts/**/*.mdx",
	schema: s
		.object({
			title: s.string().max(99),
			description: s.string().max(200),
			date: s.isodate(),
			published: s.boolean().default(true),
			tags: s.array(s.string()).optional(),
			image: s.string().optional(),
			slug: s.path(),
			body: s.mdx(),
		})
		.transform((data) => ({
			...data,
			slugAsParams: data.slug.split("/").slice(1).join("/"),
			readingTime: Math.ceil(data.body.split(/\s+/).length / 200),
		})),
});

export default defineConfig({
	root: "content",
	output: {
		data: ".velite",
		assets: "public/static",
		base: "/static/",
		name: "[name]-[hash:6].[ext]",
		clean: true,
	},
	collections: { posts },
	mdx: {
		remarkPlugins: [remarkGfm],
		rehypePlugins: [
			rehypeSlug,
			[
				rehypePrettyCode,
				{
					theme: "github-dark",
					keepBackground: false,
				},
			],
			[
				rehypeAutolinkHeadings,
				{
					behavior: "wrap",
					properties: {
						className: ["anchor"],
					},
				},
			],
		],
	},
});
</result>

# Sprint Sync Briefing - December 21, 2024

## Mode: HARDCORE (No Hand-Holding)

Welcome back. Time to ship.

---

## Current State

Portfolio MVP is complete. Core pages work. Blog system functional. Now we polish and extend.

---

## Today's Mission

Pick ONE and execute:

### Option A: Search System
Add blog search. Client-side is fine. Make it work.

### Option B: RSS Feed
Implement `/feed.xml`. Standard RSS 2.0. Include full posts.

### Option C: Project Detail Pages
Create `/projects/[slug]` routes. Show case studies with images, tech stack, links.

### Option D: Performance Audit
Run Lighthouse. Fix anything below 95. Document changes.

---

## Constraints

- No new dependencies unless absolutely necessary
- Follow existing patterns
- Tests required for new features
- PR must pass CI

---

## Resources

- ADRs in `/docs/adr/`
- Component patterns in `/components/ui/`
- Content schema in `velite.config.ts`

---

## Definition of Done

- [ ] Feature works in dev and prod build
- [ ] No TypeScript errors
- [ ] Tests pass
- [ ] Lighthouse scores maintained
- [ ] Code reviewed (self-review counts)
- [ ] Merged to main

---

Go.
</result>

## Warmup Complete - Codebase Overview

This is a **modern portfolio website** built with a clean, professional tech stack:

### Architecture Summary

**Tech Stack:**
- Next.js 15 with App Router and Turbopack
- React 19
- TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS v4
- Velite for MDX content management
- Jest + React Testing Library

**Project Structure:**
- `/app` - Next.js App Router pages (home, blog, dynamic posts)
- `/components` - React components organized by domain (blog, home, layout, mdx, ui)
- `/content/posts` - MDX blog posts
- `/lib` - Utilities for fonts, metadata, posts, and helpers
- `/docs` - Documentation including ADRs and sprint planning
- `/capstone` - Project requirements and design documentation

**Key Patterns:**
1. **Content Layer**: Velite processes MDX files with frontmatter schema validation and transforms (reading time calculation)
2. **Component Architecture**: UI primitives using CVA (class-variance-authority) with Tailwind
3. **Theme Support**: next-themes for dark/light mode with system preference detection
4. **Layout**: Sticky header, main content area, footer with consistent container spacing

**Current Sprint Focus (per SPRINT_SYNC.md):**
The team is in "hardcore mode" with options to implement:
- Search system for blog
- RSS feed
- Project detail pages
- Performance audit

### Critical Files for Implementation

- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/velite.config.ts` - Content schema and MDX processing configuration
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/app/layout.tsx` - Root layout with theme provider and structure
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/lib/posts.ts` - Post retrieval utilities
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/components/ui/badge.tsx` - UI component pattern reference
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/capstone/requirements.md` - Full project requirements and roadmap
